alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 27 at 5:25AM MST until July 27 at 8:30AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Coconino County north of Williams and Seligman... Yavapai County near Seligman and Ash Fork... * Until 830 AM MST. * At 520 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in along and up to 20 miles north of Interstate 40 from Seligman to near Ash Fork. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ash Fork, Kaibab Estates, and Seligman. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 120 and 134...and between mile markers 137 and 155. Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 140 and 146. Route 66 between mile markers 128 and 139. State Route 89 between mile markers 361 and 363. State Route 64 between mile markers 191 and 200. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Chino Wash, Pineveta Wash, Cataract Creek, Martin Dam Draw, Ash Fork Draw, Meath Wash, Big Chino Wash, Monument Wash, Red Lake Wash, Partridge Creek, Johnson Creek and Eightmile Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
